description.p: Defines whether or not drag scrolling should be enabled on the user's device to scroll the list.

discussion.p: When a UX is running on a mobile device, the List is scrolled by dragging on the List. When running on a device that supports a mouse (e.g. a desktop browser), the List is scrolled by dragging on the vertical scrollbar.

There may be cases where you want to force drag scrolling when running on a device that supports a mouse (i.e. a desktop browser). A possible reason you might want to force drag scrolling on a desktop browser is that you want to implement the 'pull to refresh' pattern to refresh the data in the List.
The *[ui:Use drag scrolling]* property lets you specify if drag scrolling should always be used to scroll the List. This property has the following choices:

item.name: Auto
item.description: If the user is on a touch device, drag scrolling is used. If the user is on a non-touch device (e.g. a device that doesn't support touch events), drag scrolling is not used.

item.name: Always
item.description: Drag scrolling is always used on touch and non-touch devices.
